result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Todd Adam Hollfelder was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge.
Pay $1,800 fine and pay all applicable, mandatory costs, fees, assessments & surcharges.  
The Court ordered that all financial obligations and/ or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due & owing is subject to civil judgment.

The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, but ONLY AFTER serving 2.5 years of this sentence and the sentence in case # 15CF713

Concurrent with: with case # 15CF713, but consecutive to any other time being served

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/ maintain full-time employment or full-time school and part-time employment.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm and his voting rights are suspended until his civil rights are restored.

NO drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/ dealers or drug houses).  
NO new law violations rising to Probable Cause.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the Probation agent.    
Mental Health assessment and any follow-up care and/ or treatment.   
Take all medications in a manner prescribed by  a treating physician.   Provide DNA sample for the Data Bank.   
Participate in any and all programming DOC thinks is appropriate or recommended by the assessing agency.

supervisions.notes: Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment.   Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY withrandom urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd Adam Hollfelder

defendant.name: Hollfelder, Todd Adam
defendant.address: 10211 West Greenfield Avenue # 84, West Allis, WI 53214

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (40 pages) commencing JULY 6, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski for Jeremy Arn   As to Count 2, pursuant to plea negotiations and because of the operation of law Court ordered Count 2 dismissed.

As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant remaned into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's department pending sentencing.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties need to determine which of defendants two pending OWI cases will be a 6th and 7th.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder not in court, in custody.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations for global resolution as to all 4 of the defendants' cases.  Defense requests date for change of plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder in custody.  Derek Waterstreet, student intern under the supervision of Karl Hayes for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder in court with attorney Alexis B Luster.  Defendant Todd Adam Hollfelder in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
